content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– New factory burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
– Dedicated interface burner inserter (using direction RIGHT) at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed next to the input chest
– Assembling machine (for copper‐cable production) at Position(1.5, 19.5)

### Extraction System Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
– Belt depot wooden chest at Position(3.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot burner inserter (using direction UP) at Position(3.5, 14.5) with pickup position (3.5, 15.5) and drop position (3.5, 13.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine (acting as the generator) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)

### Research Lab (Position not specified)
Consists of the following entity:
– Lab (electrical_id=7106) with lab input {'automation-science-pack': 17}

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Error
 Multiple steps (210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217) failed when attempting to connect transport belts directly to a steam engine target. To resolve this, always insert an intermediary (such as an inserter that accepts items into the target entity) rather than connecting a belt directly to a steam engine.

• Wooden Chest Placement Issues
 A placement error occurred because the target position (3.5, 15.5) was too far from the player’s current position, and later because no wooden chest was available in the inventory. Ensure that the player moves within the maximum placement distance and that the required item is present in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Error
 A NameError for ‘target_chest’ was raised due to an undefined variable. Verify that all variable names are declared correctly and consistently referenced throughout the code.
